file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 35-20-08-04 - PASSENGER OXYGEN CYLINDER - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL PASSENGER OXYGEN CYLINDER - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT FOR 16 PASSENGERS 1. General A. This section gives the procedure to remove/install the passenger oxygen cylinder. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY AIRCRAFT FOR 16 PASSENGER OXYGEN CYLINDER - RE- 35-20-08-000-801-A PASSENGERS MOVAL AIRCRAFT FOR 16 PASSENGER OXYGEN CYLINDER - IN- 35-20-08-400-801-A PASSENGERS STALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General CONFIG-2 35-20-08 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 35-20-08-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT FOR 16 PASSENGERS 2. PASSENGER OXYGEN CYLINDER - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the passenger oxygen cylinder. (2) The passenger oxygen cylinder is installed in the forward passenger cabin. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-26-02-000-802-A/400 - AMM TASK 35-10-00-910-801-A/200 - AMM TASK 35-10-00-910-803-A/200 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Plastic caps To close disconnected fittings AR available F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin I. Preparation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 841-004-A (1) Obey the safety precautions (AMM TASK 35-10-00-910-801-A/200) and general instructions (AMM TASK 35-10-00-910-803-A/200). (2) Open these circuit breakers: • PASS OXY DEPLOY 1 (location tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 1/MISCELLANEOUS). • PASS OXY DEPLOY 2 (location tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 2). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 35-20-08 Page 2 of 6 Rev 55 - Oct 29/18 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Remove the closeout panel (AMM TASK 25-26-02-000-802-A/400). (4) Close the cylinder pressure regulator (5). J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-004-A (1) Remove the screws (6) from the board (7). (2) Disconnect all the oxygen line fittings (2) from the cylinder pressure regulator (5). NOTE: A small quantity of oxygen can flow out when you disconnect the oxygen line fittings. (3) Install plastic caps to the open fittings. (4) Pull the board (7), with the passenger oxygen cylinder (3), out of the tracks (8). (5) Remove the mounting bracket bolts (4). (6) Remove the passenger oxygen cylinder (3). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 35-20-08 Page 3 of 6 Rev 55 - Oct 29/18 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT FOR 16 PASSENGERS Passenger Oxygen Cylinder - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A ZONE 232 B 8. TRACK DET. A 6. SCREW (3x) 5. CYLINDER 1. CLOSEOUT PRESSURE PANEL REGULATOR D 7. BOARD 2. OXYGEN LINE FITTING (4x) 8. TRACK DET. C C 2. RELIEF LINE (PORT C) 3. OXYGEN CYLINDER (PORT D) 2. SUPPLY LINE (PORT B) 4. BOLT TEE (REF.) 2. FILLER LINE (PORT A) GAUGE 2. GAUGE LINE (REF.) (PORT E) DET. D DET. B LEGENDS: PORT A: FILLER VALVE PORT PORT B: LOW PRESSURE OXYGEN SUPPLY PORT PORT C: HIGH PRESSURE RELIEF VALVE PORT (BURST DISK) PORT D: SAFETY OUTLET PORT (LOW PRESSURE RELIEF) EM145AMM350167C.DGN PORT E: HIGH PRESSURE PORT (REMOTE GAUGE, PRESSURE TRANSDUCER) EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 35-20-08 Page 4 of 6 Rev 55 - Oct 29/18 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 35-20-08-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT FOR 16 PASSENGERS 3. PASSENGER OXYGEN CYLINDER - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the passenger oxygen cylinder. (2) The passenger oxygen cylinder is installed in the forward passenger cabinet. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 12-14-00-600-801-A/300 - AMM TASK 25-26-02-400-802-A/400 - AMM TASK 35-10-00-910-801-A/200 - AMM TASK 35-10-00-910-803-A/200 - AMM TASK 35-10-00-910-805-A/200 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Plastic caps To close disconnected fittings AR available F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-004-A (1) Obey the safety precautions (AMM TASK 35-10-00-910-801-A/200) and general instructions (AMM TASK 35-10-00-910-803-A/200). (2) Put the passenger oxygen cylinder (3) on the board (7) and install the mounting bracket bolts (4). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 35-20-08 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Put the board (7), with the passenger oxygen cylinder (3), on the tracks (8). (4) Remove the plastic caps from the fittings. (5) Connect all the oxygen line fittings (2) on the oxygen cylinder regulator(s) (5). NOTE: Refer to Table 201 of the AMM TASK 35-10-00-910-805-A/200 for the torque ranges. J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-004-A (1) Open the cylinder pressure regulator (5). (2) Do a check for leaks at the fittings you worked on (AMM TASK 35-10-00-910-805-A/ 200). (3) Install the closeout panel (AMM TASK 25-26-02-400-802-A/400). (4) Close the PASS OXY DEPLOY 1 and PASS OXY DEPLOY 2 circuit breakers. (5) Check oxygen system, fill it if necessary (AMM TASK 12-14-00-600-801-A/300). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 35-20-08 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
